page.title: 01SELSEY - INTRODUCTION
page.content: Selsey was once an island but is now a peninsula.It is a very flat village,so flat that if we did not have a sea wall and there was a high tide Selsey would be partially under water.Two pages contain information about ecology and landscape. From the 9-10,000 population we have chosen to write about one day in their lives,their employment and in particular fishing,the Coastguard and trade.Their housing,education,religion and a biography of Patrick Moore are included. From the field of recreation we have included the following: sports,clubs,entertainment,events and tourism. People come to Selsey to enjoy the many sunshine hours and the beaches.
